Can you try this on testing it? But you also need to figure out how to use the WhatsApp free version on that project. 

Testing WhatsApp Automation Without Full Business Verification is Possible

It is indeed possible for your tech team to test the WhatsApp automation without completing the full business verification process. Meta provides a few options to facilitate development and testing in a sandbox environment.

Developer-Focused Testing Options:

For developers looking to build and test integrations with the WhatsApp Business Platform, Meta offers a "getting started" experience that includes a test environment. When a developer adds the WhatsApp product to their app in the Meta for Developers portal, the platform automatically creates a test WhatsApp Business Account (WABA) and a test business phone number. This setup allows for sending free test messages to a limited number of recipient phone numbers (up to 5).[1] These test phone numbers can send an unlimited number of messages to these verified recipients.[2][3]

The test environment also comes with a pre-approved "hello world" message template to begin testing immediately.[1] This allows developers to experiment with the core functionalities of the WhatsApp Business API, such as sending and receiving messages, and configuring webhooks for real-time notifications.[1][4]

Limitations of the Testing Environment:

It is important to note that this testing functionality has its limitations. The test phone number provided by Meta will display the Meta logo to recipients.[5] Furthermore, for outbound messages sent outside of a 24-hour customer service window, only pre-approved message templates can be used.[5] While the "hello world" template is provided, creating and using custom message templates for more specific use cases might still require business verification.

Using a Sandbox Environment from a Business Solution Provider (BSP):

Another avenue for testing without immediate business verification is to use a sandbox environment provided by a WhatsApp Business Solution Provider (BSP).[6][7][8] BSPs are third-party companies that offer tools and services to connect to the WhatsApp Business API.[9] Many BSPs, such as Zoho, MessageBird, and Twilio, offer their own sandbox environments that allow for prototyping and testing of WhatsApp messaging functionalities.[5][6][7] These sandboxes often come with a pre-configured WhatsApp phone number and allow you to test sending and receiving messages with your own test numbers.[6]

In summary, your developer can proceed with testing the hospitality-focused message enhancements by:

Utilizing Meta's developer test environment: By creating a developer app and adding the WhatsApp product, they will gain access to a test WABA and phone number to send and receive messages.

Leveraging a BSP's sandbox: Signing up with a BSP can provide a dedicated testing environment to prototype the desired messaging workflows.

While full business verification will eventually be necessary to launch the automation to a wider audience with a branded business profile, these testing options provide a crucial stepping stone for development and refinement without needing to immediately provide extensive business details.

Exciting news - we have a few members of the new Fall Cohort joining us for the first time on our call tomorrow. Please make sure to give them a warm welcome!

Thanks for the quick and honest reply. I appreciate you letting me know.

For future reference, our company policy is that all work hours must be logged through the TopTracker app to be eligible for payment. This is a strict rule as it's how we track project progress and process payroll.

However, since this was your very first day and you're still getting familiar with our systems, we will make a one-time exception.

Can you please give me your best estimate of how long you spent watching the 5 training videos? 

To ensure we're perfectly aligned moving forward, here is the simple daily workflow we need you to follow:
1. Start of Shift: At the very beginning of your workday, clock in by starting the tracker in TopTracker. Once it's running, send me a quick message just so I can confirm everything looks good on my end.
2. During Your Shift (Work & Breaks): All work must be done while the tracker is running. Our breaks are flexible, but you need to stop the tracker whenever you take a break (for lunch, etc.). It's very important that you remember to start it again immediately when you return to work. Only active work time should be logged.
3. End of Shift: When you're ready to finish for the day, first send me your brief End of Day (EOD) report summarizing your completed tasks, takeaways on the vid,eo and any questions. After sending the report, clock out by stopping the tracker.

We understand there's a learning curve with any new role, so no worries at all. Following these steps will ensure everything runs smoothly. Looking forward to a productive day tomorrow!
